rev.comment: repair--Dust is historically significant; Wikipedia should have an article on the band; there's nothing in the world wrong with redlinks--they point to gaps in the encyclopedia
/* Origins: late 1960s and early 1970s */ Removed red link; if there's no article page for the band, do not mention them in this article
/* Thrash metal */ included Pantera in this section as they came from "thrash" roots and were more commercially successful than the other bands mentioned (exluding of course the big four)
fallacious: because the rock article would disagree doesn't prove anything you changed + this phrase is sourced with authoritative publications+ the rock article deals with HM as subgenres of Rock
Okay, it's a genre, yet "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_music" doesn't agree. If you link to the article as a mother, then it should be the son.
/* Classical influence */ citing original source--already cited elsewhere in article
/* Classical influence */ correct source, correct quote, format cite--moving full source to biblio
/* Characteristics */ cutting claim--almost certainly true, but simply haven't been able to locate good source identifying it as a particular problem
Adding link to article in Scots wiki
rv POV and erroneous anon edits
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Tkson|Tkson]] ([[User talk:Tkson|talk]]) to last version by ClueBot
Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contributions/Tkson|Tkson]] to version by DCGeist. False positive? [[User:ClueBot/FalsePositives|report it]]. Thanks, [[User:ClueBot]]. (256762) (Bot)
/* Classical influence */ Wrong Yngwie Malmsteen never used Classical strict counterpoint or strict classical forms. Yes,he occasionally used forms of 3 voices polyphony, but no strict classical one
/* New fusions: 1990s and early 2000s */ substitute image
rv--the image isn't there to occupy a "spot," it's there to illustrate a historically significant recording, as described in the accompanying text and in the image rationale
remove non-free image in violation of [[WP:NFCC]]; violation of WP:NFCC #1, no free equivelant; free images can be made to be placed in this images spot

rv--restore consistent style; and, by the way, punctuation marks ALWAYS go inside the quotes when they did so in the original
Commas and full stops go outside the quotes (see WP:PUNC)
/* Classical influence */ Restauring this part which was deleted by an Ip without any justification
